components.description:
An emoji version of the digit 2, created via a variation selector.

Not given emoji presentation on Apple or Microsoft devices, or on platforms such as Facebook and Twitter / X. Microsoft did previously support this emoji within Windows 8 and Windows 10.
components.title: Digit Two

components.description: An emoji component character that may appear as a square with rounded corners on certain platforms.
components.title: Combining Enclosing Keycap

description: The number 2 on a square with rounded corners, designed to look like a keycap.
title: Keycap Digit Two

version.description: The following characters we added to Unicode in 1999, with most being given emoji presentation status in the years 2010-2015.

emoji_net_data.definition: Keycap Digit Two was approved as part of Unicode 3.0 in 1999 and added to Emoji 3.0 in 2016. Copy and paste this emoji: Copy http://emojipedia.org/keycap-digit-two/
emoji_net_data.name: keycap: 2

bn:00095974a: Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude
Number-two; following after the first one with nothing between them. The ordinal number corresponding to the cardinal number two.
That which comes after the first.

bn:00085859v: To determine the number (of objects in a group).
Determine the number or amount of

bn:00058285n: A concept of quantity involving zero and units
Mathematical object used to count, label, and measure
A number is one of several related types of mathematical objects.
A member of one of several classes: natural numbers, integers, rational numbers, real numbers, complex numbers, quaternions.
A set of numerals for representing numbers.

bn:00000075n: The natural number following 1 and preceding 3
A numerical value equal to 2; the second number in the set of natural numbers (especially in number theory); the cardinality of the set 0, 1; one plus one. Ordinal: second. This many dots (••).
The cardinal number that is the sum of one and one or a numeral representing this number
2 is a number, numeral, and glyph.

note: This emoji was found in merged_emojis_before_fluentui but not in FluentUI
